home.about: I design and build for the web with intention, driven by purpose, performance, and attention to detail. Crafting digital products where every interaction and element reflects the harmony between thoughtful design and precision.

imageGenerator.title: Image Generator
content: This was my very first React project! In addition to learning React and TypeScript from scratch, I also used Tailwind and shadcn/ui for the first time.

It was also the first time I integrated an API, so it was a lot of new stuff at once. Luckily, I already had some experience from earlier small projects using plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, so the transition wasn't as overwhelming as it could have been. Even though the learning curve was steep, it was super fun to see how things started to come together, from component structure and styling to data fetching and dynamic content.
The project turned out to be a great introduction to modern tools and how development can be both more efficient and more enjoyable. And of course, it gave me tons of motivation to keep exploring!

Nothing fancy here, but it works and it looks good. I connected to the Unsplash API (yep, stock photos) and used it to fetch as many images as I wanted. The first image shows as a hero image, while the rest appear in a gallery that scrolls endlessly. It's a simple concept, but it looks pretty cool.

The whole project was done in about a week, so the focus was mainly on getting the foundation in place. Afterwards, I started thinking about ways to expand it, perhaps by adding more interactivity, advanced logic, or exploring some new concepts I've learned since. But as usual, other projects and obligations got in the way.

Still, I really value what I learned from the experience. The code might feel a bit outdated now, both visually and technically, as there are many things I'd do differently today. I definitely see the potential to revisit it with fresh eyes and improved skills if the motivation strikes. The most important part is that it gave me a solid foundation for diving into modern, efficient web development.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
content: Dashboard is a project I've been working on intermittently over the past few months. It functions as a personal control panel that brings together useful tools in one place. The idea was to create something genuinely helpful for my daily life, rather than just a technical showcase I wouldn't end up using. So far, I've implemented several features, including a chat tool integrated with Gemini, a bookmarking system, and a simple notepad.

Most of the technical parts were familiar territory. I used Tailwind and shadcn/ui, which I've worked with in earlier projects, so that stayed consistent. As mentioned above, I integrated Gemini. That was a fairly straightforward process, since the API works similarly to many others. I chose Gemini over ChatGPT mainly because it's free and, in many cases, a better option.

Another important, but less visible part of the project is the flexible layout. I used dnd-kit, a library for drag-and-drop functionality, which lets users rearrange and resize the cards on the page however they like.

For data storage, I've currently opted for localStorage. It's simple and works well enough to keep user data between sessions. A database would of course provide more robust storage, but for this stage of the project, localStorage is more than sufficient. That's something I could build on later if the need arises.

I've paused development for now due to other commitments, but I absolutely plan to keep working on Dashboard regularly. There are endless possibilities for improvements, both small tweaks and larger additions.
Maybe I'll publish it eventually, we'll see :)

watchd.title: Watchd
content: This time, I've incorporated several new tools. The starting point was to build something using Sanity CMS, but as the requirements grew, so did the tech stack. That's when I implemented Prisma for the first time and connected it to PostgreSQL to model users and handle data in a robust and flexible way.

Watchd is my personal take on IMDb and Letterboxd, a platform where you can search for movies, series, or actors. I've also built a user system with support for registration using a username and password, giving you access to your own personal profile. With a user account, you can add movies and shows to your list and showcase your favorites if there's something you really enjoyed :)
In addition, there are trending pages for both movies and series, showing what's popular at the moment.

First and foremost, I used Tailwind and shadcn/ui for most of the visuals. It's lightweight, flexible, and clean, so that was a no-brainer. Things got a bit more complex when I started integrating multiple API endpoints while also wanting to include Sanity schemas. All the data is fetched from The Movie Database (TMDB). I also considered IMDb and Letterboxd, but they don't offer open support for this kind of integration.

I'm still actively working on this project and will continue until I feel it's truly complete. TMDB offers an incredible number of endpoints, so there will always be something cool to add. I also plan to update the site whenever it makes sense, hopefully sometime soon.
